lg.l: And a dead fuchsia Fuchsia. The kōtukutuku/tree fuchsia is the world’s largest species of fuchsia, with thin bark that peels in strips, and is one of Aotearoa New Zealand’s few deciduous tree species—so might appear to be dead in winter. bending
From the daylight above, to the gloam
Frondage of ferns, and the drip
To the gloom, when asway on the tip
Of a twig, the gay fantail Fantail. The pīwakawaka/fantail is a gregarious and acrobatic bird that feeds on insects. chatters;
A flirt of its fan and it flits
